page.title: 06HEALTH CARE IN CRAWLEY DOWN
page.content: The facilities for health care in Crawley Down are very good, for both humans and animals. The{Health Centre}serves Crawley Down,{Turners Hill, Sharpthorne, West {Hoathly, Copthorne}and part of {Smallfield.}There are four{doctors,}a {Health Visitor,}a{Community Nurse,}a {school nurse}and a{midwife.}There is a {dispensary}and a{speech therapy}room. Every two months a{baby clinic}is held. There is a{Nursing Home}at Huntsland and a home for{mentally handicapped {adults}at Larchwood. There is also a {dentist}in the village. At Fen Place, outside Turners Hill, there is an{old people's home. An{East Grinstead veterinary {practice}has opened a branch in Crawley Down.
